intro: Cassebeera paradoxa, commonly known as the Paradoxical Cassia, is a flowering plant native to the Amazon rainforest. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its pod fruits and nitrogen-fixing abilities. The plant features compound leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets and produces yellow to orange flowers. It thrives in humid, tropical environments with high rainfall. Due to its unique appearance and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
